title: Jennifer Aniston is not dating, hates being set up and is working on season 2 of Morning Show
text:
Jennifer Aniston split from Justin Theroux in 2017.

And during a Monday interview with her friend Howard Stern on his Sirius XM Radio program, the 50-year-old siren revealed not only is she happy being single these days but she also does not want to be set up by her friends, either. 'I hate it,' said the ex of Brad Pitt and John Mayer.

And during the lengthy interview, the Friends vet also said there will be a second season of The Morning Show, the Apple+ series which also stars Reese Witherspoon and Steve Carell.

No man, no problem: Jennifer Aniston split from Justin Theroux in 2017. And during a Monday interview with her friend Howard Stern on his Sirius XM Radio program, the 50-year-old siren revealed she is single

No time for that stuff: She said she's enjoying the single life, stating she's too busy to date

The Along Came Polly star said she's enjoying the single life, stating she's too busy to date.

And the TV star also said she likes being single.

She turned down the shock jock's offer to set her up, adding that she is not a fan of set-ups.

'Hey, listen, I just don't like being set up. I don't like it. I hate it,' she told Stern.

Aniston started dating Brad Pitt in 1998 and they married two years later, and they were married from 2000 to 2005.

No thanks! She turned down the shock jock's offer to set her up, adding that she is not a fan of set-ups. 'Hey, listen, I just don't like being set up. I don't like it. I hate it,' she told Stern

They hang out together: The movie icon and the shock jock are friends in real life too

Her men: She was wed to Justin Theroux briefly; they are seen here in 2017, the year they split. And the siren was also wed to Brad Pitt for five years; seen here in 2000

The actress started dating Justin Theroux in 2011 and they married in 2015, before their split at the end of 2017.

And the dog lover also said that she will do MS2.

'Yeah, and I'm very busy,' she added. 'For now. I'm promoting [The Morning Show]. I'm prepping for next season.'

The actress seemingly confirmed that the streaming service has already renewed the show for a second season, though it has not been confirmed by Apple yet.

More of this: And the dog lover also said that she will do MS2. 'Yeah, and I'm very busy,' she added. 'For now. I'm promoting [The Morning Show]. I'm prepping for next season'

The Morning Show is her new series that launches on the new Apple TV Plus streaming service on November 1, which she stars in alongside Reese Witherspoon.

Apple's The Morning Show is her first series regular role since leaving Friends in 2004.

The actress portrays news anchor Alex Levy, who takes on her morning show on her own after her co-anchor (Steve Carell) is fired after an alleged sexual misconduct scandal.

New show: The Morning Show is her new series that launches on the new Apple TV Plus streaming service on November 1, which she stars in alongside Reese Witherspoon

She must also contend with an ambitious journalist gunning for her job, played by Reese.

Also in her interview she said there was little-to-no chance of an official Friends reboot happening.

But they did have a meal together recently.

She explained that 'Schwimmer was in town and we all happened to have a window of time so we all got together.'

'We laughed so hard,' Aniston said, while revealing that the dinner happened at Cox's home, adding it was, 'very civilized but we laughed a lot.'

She went on to say that they all 'miss [the show] every day' and that she'd be, 'nothing without it,' but when the talk turned to a reunion show, she admitted it was a non-starter.

'I really think there is an idea if there is a reboot of the show, it won't be even close to as good what it was,' Aniston said.

'So why do it? It would ruin it,' Aniston said.
description: During a Monday interview with her friend Howard Stern on his Sirius XM Radio program, the 50-year-old siren revealed not only is she happy being single these days.
